conclusion: The direction of the light source affects the direction and length of the shadows.
Moving the light source to the back left or right changes the angle of light hitting the objects.
Shadows will move towards the front right if the light source moves to the back left.
Shadows will move towards the front left if the light source moves to the back right.
The size of the shadow depends on the angle of the light.
When the light source moves further away (back left or right), the shadows will generally become longer and more stretched out.
The shadows are cast forward, indicating the light source is behind the objects.
If the light source moves to the back left, shadows A, B, C, and D will shift towards the front right.
If the light source moves to the back left, shadows will become longer and more elongated as the light angle increases.
If the light source moves to the back right, shadows A, B, C, and D will shift towards the front left.
If the light source moves to the back right, shadows will become longer and more elongated as the light angle increases.
If the light source moves to the back left, shadows A, B, C, and D will shift towards the front right and become longer.
If the light source moves to the back right, shadows A, B, C, and D will shift towards the front left and become longer.
